Package ohos.media.camera.device

Interface Camera


  • public interface Camera
    Interface for using the camera.

    A camera object can be obtained only in the following way:

    Create a camera by calling CameraKit.createCamera(String, CameraStateCallback, EventHandler), and get camera running states by CameraStateCallback.

    The recommended operation steps are as follows:

    • Creating a camera: Call CameraKit.createCamera(String, CameraStateCallback, EventHandler). If the camera is successfully created, CameraStateCallback#onCreated(Camera) is called. Otherwise, CameraStateCallback#onCreateFailed(String, int) is called.
    • Configuring the camera: Get a CameraConfig.Builder instance by calling Camera#getCameraConfigBuilder(), and then configure the camera by calling Camera#configure(CameraConfig). If the camera is successfully configured, CameraStateCallback#onConfigured(Camera) is called. Otherwise, CameraStateCallback#onConfigureFailed(Camera, int) is called.
    • Starting looping-frame capture: After the configuration is complete, the camera is operable. Create a FrameConfig instance by FrameConfig.Builder, and then call Camera#triggerLoopingCapture(FrameConfig) to start looping-frame capture. Looping-frame capture is commonly used for preview or recording. Call Camera#triggerLoopingCapture(FrameConfig) to update configuration of looping-frame capture.
    • Starting single-frame capture: Create a FrameConfig instance by FrameConfig.Builder, and then call Camera#triggerSingleCapture(FrameConfig) to start single-frame capture. Single-frame capture is commonly used for taking a picture.
    • Stopping looping-frame capture: Call Camera#stopLoopingCapture().
    • Releasing the camera: Call Camera#release().
    Since:
    1
    SystemCapability
    SystemCapability.Multimedia#CAMERA

      • configure

        void configure​(CameraConfig config)
        Configures the camera.

        Before using this method, call Camera#getCameraConfigBuilder() to obtain a CameraConfig.Builder instance. This method is mainly used to set a surface for preview, taking pictures, or recording. The preview surface must be configured, and the other two surfaces are optional.

        If the camera is successfully configured, CameraStateCallback#onConfigured(Camera) will be called. In this case, the camera becomes operable.

        Parameters:
        config - Indicates camera configuration parameters.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - Throws this exception if config is null.
        IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if a parameter value is invalid. For example, the camera configuration is null, or the surface is null.
        IllegalStateException - Throws this exception if the camera is released or if an error occurs.
        Since:
        1

      • release

        void release​()
        Releases the camera.

        After the camera is released, all of its operations are unavailable. Any of the operations will cause an unexpected result or an exception.

        Since:
        1

      • triggerLoopingCapture

        int triggerLoopingCapture​(FrameConfig frameConfig)
        Starts looping-frame capture.

        Looping-frame capture is commonly used for preview or recording. The following conditions are required for valid calling:

        • The camera has been configured, and CameraStateCallback#onConfigured(Camera) has been called.
        • A surface for looping-frame capture has been added by calling CameraConfig.Builder#addSurface(Surface).
        Parameters:
        frameConfig - Indicates the looping-frame capture configuration.
        Returns:
        Returns the trigger ID for this capture.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if configuration of the camera or surface is null.
        IllegalStateException - Throws this exception if the camera is not in the configured state.
        Since:
        3

      • triggerLoopingGroupCapture

        int triggerLoopingGroupCapture​(List<FrameConfig> frameConfigs)
        Starts looping-frame capture based on a group of configurations.

        You can use this method for differentiated frame rate control when there are multiple concurrent streams. Ensure the following conditions are met when calling this method:

        • The camera has been configured, and CameraStateCallback#onConfigured(Camera) has been called.
        • A surface for looping-frame capture has been added by calling CameraConfig.Builder#addSurface(Surface).
        Parameters:
        frameConfigs - Indicates a group of frame configurations.
        Returns:
        Returns the trigger ID for this capture.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if the camera or the surface is not configured.
        IllegalStateException - Throws this exception if the camera is not in the configured state.
        Since:
        4

      • stopLoopingCapture

        void stopLoopingCapture​()
        Stops looping-frame capture.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - Throws this exception if the camera is not in the configured state.
        Since:
        1

      • triggerSingleCapture

        int triggerSingleCapture​(FrameConfig frameConfig)
        Starts single-frame capture.

        This method is commonly used for taking a picture.

        Before taking a picture, the camera must start looping-frame capture. The configuration of this capture will be inserted into the looping capture queue. Surfaces in the looping-frame capture configuration should also be included in this single-frame capture to obtain continuous preview or video images.

        Parameters:
        frameConfig - Indicates single-frame capture configuration.
        Returns:
        Returns the trigger ID for this capture.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if the camera or the surface is not configured.
        IllegalStateException - Throws this exception if the camera is not in the configured state.
        Since:
        3

      • triggerMultiCapture

        int triggerMultiCapture​(List<FrameConfig> frameConfigs)
        Starts multi-frame capture.

        Before taking a picture, looping-frame capture must be started. The configuration of those shoots will be inserted into the looping capture queue. Surfaces in the looping-frame capture configuration should also be included in this multi-frame capture to obtain continuous preview or video images.

        Parameters:
        frameConfigs - Indicates multi-frame capture configuration.
        Returns:
        Returns the trigger ID for this capture.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if the camera or the surface is not configured.
        IllegalStateException - Throws this exception if the camera is not in the configured state.
        Since:
        3

      • flushCaptures

        void flushCaptures​()
        Immediately stops frame captures, including looping-frame, single-frame, and multi-frame capture.

        Some in-flight captures may call FrameStateCallback#onFrameError(Camera, FrameConfig, int, FrameResult).

        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - Throws this exception if the camera is not in the configured state.
        Since:
        1
